channel.title: Worksheets on Aspose.Cells Product Family
channel.description: Recent content in Worksheets on Aspose.Cells Product Family

item.title: Manage Worksheets
item.description: Contents Summary 1 Adding Worksheets to a New Excel File 2 Adding Worksheets to a Designer Spreadsheet 3 Accessing Worksheets using Sheet Name 4 Removing Worksheets 4.1 Removing Worksheets using Sheet Index 4.2 Removing Worksheets using Sheet Name || Managing worksheets using Aspose.Cells for Python via Java is very easy. In this article, we will demonstrate added, accessing, and removing worksheets using the Aspose.

item.title: Copying and Moving Worksheets
item.description: Sometimes, you do need a number of worksheets with common formatting and data. For example, if you work with quarterly budgets, you might want to create a workbook with sheets that contain the same column headings, row headings, and formulas. There is a way to do this: by creating one sheet and then copying it. Aspose.Cells supports copying and moving worksheets within or between workbooks. Worksheets, complete with data, formatting, tables, matrices, charts, images, and other objects, are copied with the highest degree of precision.

item.title: Cut and Paste Cells
item.description: Contents Summary 1 Cut and Paste Cells || Cut and Paste Cells Aspose.Cells for Python via Java provides the ability to cut and paste cells. For this, the API provides the [insertCutCells](https://docs.aspose.com/apireference.aspose.com/cells/python/asposecells.api/cells#insertCutCells(com.aspose.cells.Range, int, int, int)) method of the Cells collection. The [insertCutCells](https://docs.aspose.com/apireference.aspose.com/cells/python/asposecells.api/cells#insertCutCells(com.aspose.cells.Range, int, int, int)) method accepts the following parameters. Range: The range of cells to be cut.

item.title: Count the number of cells in the Worksheet
item.description: Contents Summary 1 Count the number of cells in the Worksheet || Count the number of cells in the Worksheet Aspose.Cells for Python via Java provides the ability to count the number of cells in the worksheet. For this, the API provides the Cells.getCount() or Cells.getCountLarge() properties. The following code snippet shows how to use the Cells.

item.title: Get Hyperlinks in Range
item.description: Contents Summary 1 Get Hyperlinks in Range || Get Hyperlinks in Range To get hyperlinks in range, use the getHyperlinks() property of the Range class. The getHyperlinks() property gets all the hyperlinks in the selected range. The following code snippet shows how to get all hyperlinks in the selected range.

item.title: Get Range with External Links
item.description: Contents Summary 1 Get Range with External Links || Get Range with External Links There are many instances where excel files access data from other excel files by the use of external links. Aspose.Cells for Python via Java provides the option to retrieve these external links by using the Name.GetReferredAreas method. The Name.GetReferredAreas method returns an array of type ReferredArea.

item.title: Find if the Worksheet is Dialog Sheet
item.description: Contents Summary 1 Possible Usage Scenarios 2 Find if the Worksheet is Dialog Sheet 3 Console Output || Possible Usage Scenarios Dialog Sheet is an old format of the sheet that contains a dialog box. Such a sheet could be inserted by an older version of Microsoft Excel e.g. 2003 as shown in this screenshot. It can also be inserted with VBA in newer versions e.
